repositories.name: Estimation-Platform
repositories.readmeContent:
# Estimation Platform

Irrigation system estimation and proposal generation platform for contractors.

## Overview

This platform handles the complete proposal workflow including:
- Task code selection and CAD file uploads
- Material list generation and task mapping
- Labor cost calculation with location-based pricing
- Automated margin, tax, and profit calculations
- Proposal creation with grouping and customization
- Invoice generation with deposit/payment tracking

## Installation & Setup

---

### 1.Create virtual environment

```
python3 -m venv venv
```

### 2.Activate virtual environment

```
source venv/bin/activate
```

### 3.Update pip to latest version

```
python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip setuptools wheel
```

### 4.Install requirements

```
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
```

### 5.Make migrations

```
python3 manage.py makemigrations
```

### 6.Migrate changes

```
python3 manage.py migrate
```

### 7. Start Server

```
python3 manage.py runserver
```

### 8. Start Celery
```
celery -A laurel worker -l info --beat --scheduler django
```

## Steps to install and run Laurel Project

### 1.Create virtual environment

repositories.name: Rental-Platform
repositories.readmeContent:
# Rental Platform

Equipment rental management platform for tracking orders, deliveries, returns, and inventory.

## Overview

This platform manages the complete equipment rental lifecycle including:
- Order creation with recurring rental support
- Multi-stage delivery tracking (Create → Pick Up → Check Out → Delivered)
- Return process management with inspection workflows
- Inventory/stock management integration
- Customer and account manager relationship tracking

## Installation & Setup

---

### 1.Create virtual environment

```
python3 -m venv venv
```

### 2.Activate virtual environment

```
source venv/bin/activate
```

### 3.Update pip to latest version

```
python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip setuptools wheel
```

### 4.Install requirements

```
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
```

### 5.Make migrations

```
python3 manage.py makemigrations
```

### 6.Migrate changes

```
python3 manage.py migrate
```

### 7. Start Server

```
python3 manage.py runserver
```

### 8. Start Celery
```
celery -A laurel worker -l info --beat --scheduler django
```

repositories.name: braindead
repositories.readmeContent:
# Getting Started with Create React App

This project was bootstrapped with [Create React App](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app).

## Available Scripts

In the project directory, you can run:

### `npm start`

Runs the app in the development mode.\
Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) to view it in your browser.

The page will reload when you make changes.\
You may also see any lint errors in the console.

### `npm test`

Launches the test runner in the interactive watch mode.\
See the section about [running tests](https://facebook.github.io/create-react-app/docs/running-tests) for more information.

### `npm run build`

Builds the app for production to the `build` folder.\
It correctly bundles React in production mode and optimizes the build for the best performance.

The build is minified and the filenames include the hashes.\
Your app is ready to be deployed!

See the section about [deployment](https://facebook.github.io/create-react-app/docs/deployment) for more information.

### `npm run eject`

**Note: this is a one-way operation. Once you `eject`, you can't go back!**

If you aren't satisfied with the build tool and configuration choices, you can `eject` at any time. This command will remove the single build dependency from your project.

Instead, it will copy all the configuration files and the transitive dependencies (webpack, Babel, ESLint, etc) right into your project so you have full control over them. All of the commands except `eject` will still work, but they will point to the copied scripts so you can tweak them. At this point you're on your own.

You don't have to ever use `eject`. The curated feature set is suitable for small and middle deployments, and you shouldn't feel obligated to use this feature. However we understand that this tool wouldn't be useful if you couldn't customize it when you are ready for it.

## Learn More

You can learn more in the [Create React App documentation](https://facebook.github.io/create-re

repositories.name: brian_m
repositories.readmeContent:
# Brian M's Learning Platform

This repository hosts a collection of small React experiments and mini‑games. The app acts as a personal playground where different ideas are prototyped using React, React Router and Tailwind CSS. Each feature is accessible from the navigation bar and can be explored individually.

## Setup

1. Install dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```
2. (Optional) Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and provide your Firebase credentials if you want to enable Firebase features.
3. Start the development server:
   ```bash
   npm start
   ```
4. To create a production build:
   ```bash
   npm run build
   ```
5. Run the test suite (requires dependencies to be installed):
   ```bash
   npm test
   ```

## Features

- **Snack Trail** – A light‑hearted, snack‑themed take on the classic Oregon Trail. Manage your crew and snacks while random events push you toward the goal.
- **Pixel Lab** – A 16×16 pixel art maker complete with color palette, brush and eraser tools, and a private gallery saved to local storage.
- **Robot Room** – Assemble robots from hundreds of randomly generated parts. Each robot has unique stats that change as you swap components.
- **Build Mode** – A simple LEGO building interface where you place pieces, choose colors and follow small build instructions.
- **Inventory** – Search and filter a sample LEGO inventory to keep track of your pieces.
- **RC Plane Designer** – Pick a style and color to craft a custom remote control plane.
- **Alchemy** – Mix and match elements in a playful Little Alchemy‑style puzzle.
- **The Matrix** – Enter your name, pick a pill and see how deep the rabbit hole goes. Includes a boot transition, terminal challenge.
- **Matrix Portal** – A portal page (work in progress) intended for future connectivity between Matrix features.

Enjoy exploring the different experiments contained in this project!

repositories.name: dad-ticker
repositories.readmeContent:
# BTC Net-Worth Dashboard

This project tracks and visualizes cryptocurrency holdings. It is built with Next.js and Tailwind CSS.

## Setup

1. **Install dependencies**
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

2. **Environment variables**
   - `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE` – optional override for API endpoints.

3. **Run in development**
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

4. **Build and start**
   ```bash
   npm run build
   npm start
   ```

5. **Run tests**
   ```bash
   npm test
   ```

## Scripts

- `npm run dev` – start the Next.js development server.
- `npm run build` – create a production build.
- `npm start` – run the production build.
- `npm test` – execute unit tests with Vitest.
- `npm run color-check` – scan for hardcoded gray colors to ensure theme consistency.

## Folder Structure

- `components/` – React components
- `contexts/` – React context providers
- `hooks/` – reusable hooks
- `pages/` – Next.js pages and API routes
- `src/services/` – data fetching utilities
- `tests/` – Vitest unit tests

## License

This project is released under the MIT License.

scripts.report:pdf:all: npm run report:build && npm run forms:pdf && npm run nc:pdf && npm run report:pdf

repositories.name: metropolitan-partners-portal
repositories.readmeContent:
# Global Worldwide Group Project Portal (Prototype)

This is a prototype portal developed to demonstrate potential approaches for centralizing Global Worldwide Group's data infrastructure and reporting capabilities. It serves as a conceptual visualization based on Phase 1 discovery findings.

## Purpose

This prototype demonstrates:
- Centralized access to organizational data and documentation
- Interactive visualizations of team structures and process flows
- Conceptual layouts for systems and reports catalogs
- Sample approaches to relationship mapping between systems and teams

## Important Notes

- **This is a demonstration only** - Features are limited and data is static
- All data shown is based on Phase 1 discovery findings
- This prototype serves as a visualization tool to spark discussion about possible future directions
- Not intended for production use

## Technical Details

Built with:
- Next.js 14 (App Router)
- TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS
- Shadcn UI Components
- D3.js for visualizations

## Development

```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Run development server
npm run dev

# Build for production
npm run build
```

## Project Structure

- `src/app/` - Next.js App Router pages
- `src/components/` - React components
  - `project-portal/` - Domain-specific components
  - `ui/` - Reusable UI components
- `src/data/` - Static data files
- `src/utils/` - Utility functions and services

## Deployment

This prototype is deployed on Vercel and can be accessed at [URL].

## Disclaimer

This portal is a proof-of-concept developed during the Phase 1 discovery process. It is not a production system and serves solely as a demonstration of potential approaches to addressing visibility and accessibility challenges identified in our analysis.

repositories.name: mike-os
repositories.readmeContent:
# Mike-OS

**AI-Powered Operating System for Digital Acceleration**

Mike-OS is a comprehensive platform that combines AI automation, community building, and revenue generation into a unified operating system for the digital age.

## 🚀 **Latest: Golden Tile Revenue System**

**NEW:** Revolutionary referral system that transforms hobby communities into revenue-generating partnerships.

### 🀄 **Golden Tile Club - Pilot Program**
- **Target:** $5K revenue in 30 days
- **Model:** $2.99 membership with hidden Golden Tile rewards
- **Strategy:** Discovery-based progression (Friend Finder → Community Builder → Golden Shepherd)

📖 **Documentation:**
- [Golden Tile Master Plan](docs/golden-tile-master-plan.md) - Complete strategy & execution plan
- [Technical Coordination](docs/golden-tile-technical-coordination.md) - System integration guide
- [Production Deployment](docs/golden-tile-production-deployment.md) - Live setup and monitoring
- [V1 Launch Ready](docs/v1-launch-ready.md) - Shareable plan and checklists

## 🏗️ **Core Architecture**

### **Agent Orchestration System**
- **Agent 1-8:** Specialized AI agents for different domains
- **Veronica:** Central orchestrator managing all agents
- **Real Execution:** Agents can run actual npm commands and modify code

### **Community Platforms**
- **Golden Tile Club:** Premium mahjong community with hidden reward system
- **Wake-Up Branding Studio:** Enterprise brand management
- **Script Manager:** Automated development workflow
- **200+ Applications:** Comprehensive ecosystem

### **Revenue Engineering**
- **Golden Tile System:** Hidden referral rewards with tier progression
- **Community-First Approach:** Value before monetization
- **Template Scalability:** Replicable across hobby communities

## 📂 **Project Structure**

```
mike-os/
├── src/
│   ├── app/                          # Next.js 13+ App Router
│   │   ├── marlenes-mahjong-center/  # 🀄 Golden Tile Club pilot
│   │   ├── agent-*/                  # AI agent i

scripts.sg:build: npm run sg:validate && npm run build

repositories.name: notice-board
repositories.readmeContent:
# Notice Board

A digital transformation quest board with delightful micro-interactions and a focus on developer experience.

## Features
- Interactive quest cards with smooth animations
- Theme toggle with playful sun/moon transition
- Team member contribution hover states
- Reward badge progression system
- Code standards documentation

## Getting Started

```bash
npm install
npm run dev
```

</rewritten_file>
